name: Granulomatous Polyangiitis with Eosinophilic Predominance (GPE)
chief_complaint: I've had persistent joint pain, fatigue, and these weird rashes that won't go away.
prognosis: Guarded; requires aggressive immunosuppression with high relapse risk (40% at 5 years), but newer biologics show promise for eosinophil-targeted control
description: A rare ANCA-associated vasculitis variant characterized by necrotizing granulomatous inflammation with disproportionate eosinophilic infiltration affecting small-to-medium vessels. Distinct from classic GPA by its Th2-mediated pathology and IL-5 driven eosinophilia. Often presents with overlapping features of eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis (EGPA) and granulomatosis with polyangiitis (GPA).
risk_factors: chronic nasal methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus colonization
